divs: Sighting DetailsAt 9:50pm EST was outside stargazing after two people left who came to see a piece of furniture I was selling being stored in the garage. I noticed a very bright star or planet just a few degrees to the east of the big dipper arm and said to my self that is not in the right place as I am an amateur astronomer. The skies were clear but with summer haze so that I could barely see secondary stars. As my eyes adjusted to it's precise location in relation to known stars I perceived it to be moving at a much slower pace than common aircraft speed but also at altitude equal to common airliners. I did not notice any flashing red wing lights, Just a single bright point of light. At that point the object seemed very odd to me although I am located in a high traffic aircraft zone military and commercial. The object then made an abrupt acceleration northbound at tremendous velocity that I perceived supersonic because of my naval aviation experience. I did not see any afterburner or hear any sonic boom. I quickly ran to the south side of my neighbors parking area so that I would not lose sight of the object as it moved towards the tree line on the north side of the property. As I looked up again after moving I could not relocate it.
trends: There have been 15 other sightings in Middletown
There were no other sightings in Middletown on or around June 12th 2009
Summary: Northbound planet like object accelerating from slow to high speed.
